Bank Asia Limited Logo Bank Asia Limited is a private sector commercial bank in Bangladesh. Mr. Arfan Ali is the President and Managing Director of the bank. Source
You can download theBank Asialogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Bank Asia
item.description: Bank Asia Limited is a private sector commercial bank in Bangladesh. Mr. Arfan Ali is the President and Managing Director of the bank. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Nagad Logo Nagad is a Bangladeshi Digital Financial Service, operating under the authority of Bangladesh Post Office, an attached department of the Ministry of Post and Telecommunication, and operated by Third Wave Technologies Limited. It is the new version of the previously introduced Postal Cash Card and Electronic Money Transfer System of the Bangladesh Post Office. Nagad headquarters located at Kemal Atatürk Avenue in Dhaka, Bangladesh. Source
You can download theNagadlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Nagad
item.description: Nagad is a Bangladeshi Digital Financial Service, operating under the authority of Bangladesh Post Office, an attached department of the Ministry of Post and Telecommunication, and operated by Third Wave Technologies Limited. It is the new version of the previously introduced Postal Cash Card and Electronic Money Transfer System of the Bangladesh Post Office. Nagad headquarters located at Kemal Atatürk Avenue in Dhaka, Bangladesh. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
bKash Logo
bKash is a mobile financial service in Bangladesh operating under the authority of Bangladesh Bank as a subsidiary of BRAC Bank Limited. This mobile money system started as a joint venture between BRAC Bank Limited, Bangladesh and Money in Motion LLC, United States of America. As a mobile financial service provider in Bangladesh through bKash users can deposit money into their mobile accounts and then access a range of services, in particular transferring and receiving money domestically, making payments.
You can download thebKashlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: bKash
item.description: bKash is a mobile financial service in Bangladesh operating under the authority of Bangladesh Bank as a subsidiary of BRAC Bank Limited. This mobile money system started as a joint venture between BRAC Bank Limited, Bangladesh and Money in Motion LLC, United States of America. As a mobile financial service provider in Bangladesh through bKash users can deposit money into their mobile accounts and then access a range of services, in particular transferring and receiving money domestically, making payments.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Teletalk Logo Teletalk Bangladesh Limited DBA Teletalk is the only state-owned GSM, 3G, LTE based mobile phone operator in Bangladesh that started operating in 2004. As on February 2020, Teletalk has a subscriber base of 5.532 million. Source
You can download theTeletalklogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Teletalk
item.description: Teletalk Bangladesh Limited DBA Teletalk is the only state-owned GSM, 3G, LTE based mobile phone operator in Bangladesh that started operating in 2004. As on February 2020, Teletalk has a subscriber base of 5.532 million. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Biman Bangladesh Airlines Logo
Biman Bangladesh Airlines, commonly known as Biman, pronounced, is the national flag carrier of Bangladesh. With its main hub at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport in Dhaka, the airline also operates flights from its secondary hubs at Shah Amanat International Airport in Chittagong and as well as Osmani International Airport in Sylhet. The airline provides international passenger and cargo services to multiple destinations and has air service agreements in 42 countries.
You can download theBiman Bangladesh Airlineslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Biman Bangladesh Airlines
item.description: Biman Bangladesh Airlines, commonly known as Biman, pronounced, is the national flag carrier of Bangladesh. With its main hub at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport in Dhaka, the airline also operates flights from its secondary hubs at Shah Amanat International Airport in Chittagong and as well as Osmani International Airport in Sylhet. The airline provides international passenger and cargo services to multiple destinations and has air service agreements in 42 countries.
